subject: Re: [junit] execute all tests in a jar
msgSnippet: ... Not with core JUnit, but you should look at cpsuite and https://github.com/dhemery/runtime-suite ... . = a test has started E = a test has failed. David
messageBody:
On Tue, Nov 30, 2010 at 4:03 PM, xdzgor <pk@...> wrote:
> Hi
>
> I have a couple of questions:
>
> (1) To run JUnit tests from the command-prompt, I can use JUnitCore. I have to specify each test class I wish to run. Is it possible to specify a jar file, which JUnitCore will inspect for all available test classes, and execute them?

Not with core JUnit, but you should look at cpsuite and
https://github.com/dhemery/runtime-suite

> (2) What does the output "EE.EE.EE.EE" etc, from JUnitCore mean?

. = a test has started
E = a test has failed.

David Saff

>
> Thanks,
> Peter
>
>
